title: 105_hr1381
content: REVOLVING FUND. The United States Institute for Environmental Conflict Resolution Revolving Fund is established in the Treasury, administered by the Foundation. The Fund consists of appropriated amounts and payments. The Foundation will use the Fund for necessary expenses to operate the Institute, including salaries, administration, mediation services, and other reasonable expenses as determined by the Board. The Revolving Fund, separate from the Trust Fund, is used for operating the Institute, including salaries, administration, mediation services, and other necessary expenses determined by the Board. It is not subject to certain program priorities and the Secretary of the Treasury invests excess amounts in interest-bearing investments. The Revolving Fund is used for operating the Institute, including salaries, administration, and mediation services. Investments in interest-bearing obligations of the United States can be made by the Secretary of the Treasury. Obligations may be acquired on original issue or by purchase of outstanding obligations at the market price. Any obligation acquired by the Revolving Fund may be sold at the market price. The Secretary of the Treasury can sell the Revolving Fund at market price. Interest and proceeds from obligations in the Fund are credited back to it. The Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 is amended to include a new section allowing the use of the Institute by a federal agency. The Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 is amended to authorize federal agencies to utilize the Foundation and Institute for assessment, mediation, or related services in environmental, public lands, or natural resources disputes. Federal agencies can contract and pay for Institute services, with payments going into a Revolving Fund. Notification and concurrence procedures are also outlined. Federal agencies must notify the chairperson of the President's Council on Environmental Quality before using the Foundation or Institute for services in environmental disputes. Notifications should include details on the issues, parties involved, and prior resolution efforts by the agency. Federal agencies must obtain the concurrence of the chairperson of the President's Council on Environmental Quality before using the Foundation or Institute for services in environmental disputes. This includes providing details on the issues, parties involved, and prior resolution efforts by the agency. Federal agencies must obtain the chairperson of the President's Council on Environmental Quality's approval before utilizing the Foundation or Institute for environmental dispute services. Authorization of appropriations for the Trust Fund and Revolving Fund under the Morris K. Udall Scholarship Act is amended. $3,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 1998 and $2,100,000 for each fiscal year from 1999 to 2002. Conforming amendments are also made. The Morris K. Udall Scholarship Act authorizes appropriations for the Trust Fund and Revolving Fund. Conforming amendments are made to sections of the Act, changing references from "Fund" to "Trust Fund."
